Biography

2023: During his first season as a Panther, appeared in 39 games and made 25 starts...batted .247 going 24-for-97 at the dish...scored nine runs and collected two doubles, two homers, and 14 RBI...hit a walk-off homer on April 8 at home against Saginaw Valley State...torched left-handed pitching for a .500 average (13-26)...went 3-for-5 as a pinch hitter...had two hits in four at-bats in his debut against Hillsdale on Feb. 10...drove in two runs against Hillsdale on Feb. 12...drove in six runs during the Saginaw Valley State series.

Prior to DU: Spent three seasons at the University of Southern California...during 2020, appeared in six games during the pandemic season...did have three at-bats and one run scored...walked twice and did not commit an error in the field...as a sophomore in 2021, appeared in 17 games and made four starts for the Trojans...posted a slash line of .389/.522/.556 while hitting three doubles...had seven base hits, scored nine runs, and recorded three RBI...posted one multi-hit and one multi-RBI game...as a junior in 2022, appeared in 14 games and made five starts in the outfield...had 15 at-bats and scored two runs.

High School: Prepped at Forest Hills Central (Mich.) under head coach Todd Hartman...named to the OK-White First Team as a junior and senior...named All-State First Team in 2018...batted .506 with 41 runs, 29 RBI, 19 extra-base hits, 31 stolen bases, and a .595 on-base percentage in 29 games in 2018...played summer ball for Evoshield Canes National, helping the team to a No. 1 national ranking by Perfect Game by the end of the summer in 2016.

Personal: Majoring in business management...son of Pablo and Julie Rodriguez...born on October 11...favorite movie is Star Wars.
